TopicTitle: "Eve: Order Zero" -- a KSP Graphic Novel (POSTLUDE COMPLETE...bet you didn't see THAT coming.)

Articles.Content:
This is a Kuzzter comic. There is no forth wall.

11 kerbometers.
Landing predicted: 4.8 km...
19 kliks. Fourth wall breaking can be hilarious if done right.

You said it'll be powered landing. That can be made rather precise with a good pilot... 3km?

Careful with fourth wall breaches on Eve... you know, the pressure.

420 meters.

It looks really close tho.

![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
Thanks everybody, I hope to get the M7 down over the weekend. Kuzz Jr. is sitting next to me and he says 2m: "I know you too well, Dad!"

> 
> Thanks everybody, I hope to get the M7 down over the weekend. Kuzz Jr. is sitting next to me and he says 2m: "I know you too well, Dad!"

LOL ! Kuzz Jr. is the best ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> 19 kliks. Fourth wall breaking can be hilarious if done right.

Debatable.

> 
> Debatable.

Yes. Every narrative choice an author makes is infinitely debatable; that's why there are so many different kinds of stories. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Erm. This comic appeared in my dream last night. ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)

Not like I was in the comic, like literally this thread was in my dream. And kuzzter responded to my last post by saying "can't say too much without ruining the story, although it will be based off of (insert story here that I don't remember)"

Weird stuff. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> Erm. This comic appeared in my dream last night. ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)
> Not like I was in the comic, like literally this thread was in my dream. And kuzzter responded to my last post by saying "can't say too much without ruining the story, although it will be based off of (insert story here that I don't remember)"
> 
> Weird stuff. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

That means the contents of this thread are embedded in your subconscious.
Landing predicted at 273 meters. I have faith in ya, Kuzz!

I have faith in you. 3.4 K.M.

Or maybe more...

Can't decide...

> 
> Erm. This comic appeared in my dream last night. ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)

Wow--what wall did THAT break?

> 
> Wow--what wall did THAT break?

The subconscious wall I think. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> Wow--what wall did THAT break?

 The 4^2 wall.
2.1 km
3 km.
If you somehow get it 100km offtarget, at least you can still have the two ride in the billmobile over there.
... 30km. Sorry but the M7 looks very heavy. I would consider this still as a precise landing ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif).
It's funny how the texture replacer's visor reflections add to the overall story. Am I the only one who noticed it?

> 
> It's funny how the texture replacer's visor reflections add to the overall story. Am I the only one who noticed it?

Not at all. It's definitely made some of the shots look very beautiful. I'm loving the graphics.

Happy landings!
**By the way, flinging ham sandwiches to orbit of Gilly is impossible.**

![be2d0673c0c4b6d84a49f90f51a67a0d.png](https://i.gyazo.com/be2d0673c0c4b6d84a49f90f51a67a0d.png)

Did you got another message from mods kuzzter?
711 meters
